byline.contributor: Arielle Dollinger reported from Central Islip, and Marc Santora from New York. William K. Rashbaum contributed reporting from New York.
byline.original: By ARIELLE DOLLINGER and MARC SANTORA

abstract: Former Suffolk County, NY, Police Chief James Burke pleads guilty to federal charges that he assaulted and threatened suspect while in custody in 2012, and pressured fellow officers into covering up incident; case led to federal investigation into Police Department and office of Suffolk County District Atty Thomas J. Spota.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Burke was facing federal civil rights charges stemming from accusations that he beat a suspect in police custody and coerced his fellow officers into covering up the episode.

headline.main: James Burke, Ex-Suffolk County Police Chief, Pleads Guilty
headline.print_headline: Former Suffolk Police Chief Pleads Guilty  to Beating Suspect and Plotting Cover-Up
